title: W.H.O. Researcher Seeking Coronavirus Origins on His Trip to China
description: An interview with Peter Daszak, an animal disease specialist, just after his return from an investigative research mission to Wuhan, the site of the original Covid outbreak, and surrounding areas.

title: U.K. Virus Variant Is Probably Deadlier, Scientists Say
description: New research finds that the British variant is “likely” to be linked to a higher risk of hospitalization and death, laying bare the danger facing countries that ease restrictions.

title: CDC Draws Up a Blueprint for Reopening Schools
description: Amid an acrid national controversy, the agency proposed detailed criteria for returning students to classrooms.

title: David Katzenstein, AIDS Researcher With Focus on Africa, Dies at 69
description: He honed methods of prevention, diagnosis and treatment, and made them accessible to underserved populations in sub-Sahara Africa. He died of Covid-19.

title: On W.H.O. Trip, China Refused to Hand Over Important Data
description: The information could be key to determining how and when the outbreak started, and to learning how to prevent future pandemics.

title: As Millions Get Covid Vaccine Shots, F.D.A. Struggles With Safety Monitoring
description: For now, the government has been relying on a patchwork of programs that officials say are hampered by limited size and gaps in data collection.

title: Dr. Fauci Cautiously Optimistic for a Complete 2021 MLB Season
description: With spring training looming, the infectious disease expert — and Washington Nationals fan — weighs in on his optimism for the baseball season and whether he’d feel safe at a game.

title: Covid Vaccines for Kids Are Coming, but Not for Many Months
description: Pfizer and Moderna are testing their vaccines on children 12 and older and hope to have results by the summer.

title: Covid-Linked Syndrome in Children Is Growing and Cases Are More Severe
description: The condition, which usually emerges several weeks after infection, is still rare, but can be dangerous. “A higher percentage of them are really critically ill,” one doctor said.

title: Piecing Together the Next Pandemic
description: From a small lab in Cambodia, Dr. Jessica Manning is on the lookout for emerging diseases.

title: ‘Right Now Feels So Long and Without Any End in Sight’
description: More than 700 people have been keeping digital diaries as part of Pandemic Journaling Project. It may be the most complete record of our shifting moods in this isolating year.

title: An Inside Look at Cuba’s Constant Struggle for Clean Water
description: Across the country, battling water scarcity requires a vast array of workers, from inspectors and fumigators to truck drivers and pipe layers.

title: How Scientists Are Trying to Spot New Viruses Before They Cause Pandemics
description: Scientists want to build a weather system for viruses. It would require a big financial investment, plus buy-in from doctors, hospitals and blood banks.

title: There’s No ‘One Size Fits All’ Treatment for Asthma
description: A new set of guidelines recognizes the complexity in the interaction between a patient’s genetics and the environment.

title: 7 Virus Variants Found in U.S. Carrying the Same Mutation
description: Scientists don’t know yet whether the mutation makes the variants more contagious, but they are concerned that it might.

title: Despair Deepens for Young People as Pandemic Drags On
description: Experts paint a grim picture of the struggle with lockdown isolation — a “mental health pandemic” that should be treated as seriously as containing the coronavirus.

title: New Yorkers With Many Health Conditions Are Now Eligible for Vaccination
description: People with conditions like obesity, hypertension, pulmonary diseases and cancer flooded the state’s sign-up site.

title: Sharing Unexpected Acts of Kindness
description: Ahead of Valentine’s Day, we asked readers to share moments when they stumbled upon acts of affection. Here are some of their stories.

title: Ways to Enjoy Theater Virtually
description: Missing live performances during the pandemic? Get your theater fix with a handful of online stellar productions (new and old).

title: Things To Do At Home
description: This week, celebrate Presidents’ Day, tune in to a discussion between two members of the Tuskegee Airmen Inc. and try a new recipe for Mardi Gras.

title: Three Men Are Accused in Scheme to Sell Covid-19 Vaccines
description: Prosecutors said the men created a fake duplicate of the Moderna website to fraudulently sell doses of the vaccine, which they never had.

title: What You Need to Know About the CDC's New School Guidelines
description: The federal government’s new guidance for reopening classrooms does not require teachers to be vaccinated first.

title: FDA Agrees Moderna Can Increase Vaccine Supply in Each Vial
description: Federal regulators are in favor of a simple, potentially quick fix to bolster coronavirus vaccine supplies: more doses per bottle.

title: Dr. John Bentson, Who Invented a Better Brain-Imaging Tool, Dies at 83
description: He was a neuroradiologist who came up with an improved way to provide imaging of problems in the brain and spinal cord. He died of complications of Covid-19.

title: Pharmacies move to the forefront of the U.S. vaccine campaign.
With More Vaccines Secured, Biden Warns of Hurdles to Come
description: The Biden administration has secured more coronavirus vaccines, but the president struck a cautious tone about logistical issues that could keep some Americans from being vaccinated.

title: We Asked 175 Pediatric Disease Experts if It Was Safe Enough to Open School
description: In many places, the debates over reopening are fraught. But in a survey, experts broadly agreed that elementary schools didn’t need vaccines to open safely.

title: Tiny Blobs of Brain Cells Could Reveal How Your Mind Differs From a Neanderthal’s
description: Researchers grew clusters of brain cells in the lab with a gene carried by our ancient ancestors.

title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is barred from Instagram over false coronavirus claims.
Emptying the Dishwasher Can Enrich Kids’ Mental Health
description: Guiding children toward mastery of new skills can help them thrive — and get some household chores done at the same time.

title: Americans Must Ensure Masks Fit Snugly or Double Up, C.D.C Says
description: With the vaccine rollout moving slowly and contagious coronavirus variants spreading, the agency said masks still offered powerful protection — if worn correctly.

title: Semaglutide Brings Significant Weight Loss in Obese Patients
description: In a clinical trial, participants taking semaglutide lost 15 percent of their body weight, on average.

title: Helen Etuk, Who Planned to Be a Pediatrician, Dies at 20
description: She was attending classes at the University of North Texas when she caught the coronavirus, her mother said. She died of complications of the virus.

title: How Merck's Vaccine Lost the Covid Race
description: After ending its own Covid-19 vaccine trials, the company said that it was actively discussing with governments how to help its competitors make their shots.

title: Primary Care Doctors Feel Left Out of Vaccine Rollout
description: In the rush to immunize people against Covid, federal and state health officials have overlooked the role of doctors, physicians say.

title: Can’t Find an N95 Mask? This Company Has 30 Million That It Can’t Sell.
description: Health workers are still being forced to ration protective masks, but small U.S. manufacturers can’t find buyers, and some are in a danger of going under.

title: The Hardship of Social Distancing When Touch Is a Lifeline
description: For me, and many others with physical disabilities, touch is not merely a luxury or a pleasure, but an aspect of my functionality, my basic survival.

title: Broad Coalition of Health Industry Groups Calls for Obamacare Expansion
description: Hospitals, doctors, insurers and employers say the Affordable Care Act can help the country achieve universal coverage

title: Childhood Colds Do Not Prevent Coronavirus Infection, Study Finds
description: New research casts doubt on the idea that prior infections with garden-variety coronaviruses might shield some people, particularly children, amid the pandemic.

title: College Student’s Simple Invention Helps Nurses Work and Patients Rest
description: The device, a wearable night light that can minimize disturbances for sleeping patients, is the brainchild of a University of Pennsylvania senior and a neonatal I.C.U. nurse.

title: With Vaccines in More Drugstores, Pharmacies Go on Hiring Sprees
description: Pharmacies are dangling five-figure signing bonuses and competing against one another to quickly recruit pharmacists and support staff.

title: Running Is a Total Body Affair
description: We can thank our heads and shoulders — and not just our knees and toes — that we evolved to run as well as we do.

title: Biden Pushes for Racial Equity in Vaccination, but Data Lags
description: The administration has race and ethnicity data for just 52 percent of vaccine recipients. Next week, it will begin shipping doses directly to clinics in underserved communities.

title: Could a Single Vaccine Work Against All Coronaviruses?
description: Scientists are working on a shot that could protect against Covid-19, its variants, certain seasonal colds — and the next coronavirus pandemic.

title: Study Finds People With Dementia Are Twice as Likely to Get Covid
description: The analysis of nearly 62 million electronic medical records in the U.S. also found that Black people with dementia were at an even greater risk.

title: China Scores a Public Relations Win After W.H.O. Mission to Wuhan
description: Experts with the global health agency endorsed critical parts of Beijing’s narrative, even some parts that independent scientists question.

title: Colleges vowed a safer spring, but then students, and variants, arrived.
